free_text.Prerequisite for: Master in life sciences & technology, specialization in molecular[br/]medicine.
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic knowledge of molecular biology and genetics.
free_text.Content: The 2x5 credit course starts in the fall semester and continues throughout the spring semester. In the fall semester, the following topics are covered:[br/][br/]1. Tumorigenesis (chemical & physical carcinogenesis, infectious disease and cancer, cancer susceptibility/heredity, tumor clonality).[br/]2. Oncogenic signaling (the cell cycle, genome stability, replicative[br/]potential, epigenetic regulation of gene expression, apoptosis, signal[br/]transduction, intercellular communication).
free_text.Learning outcomes: Introduction to the basic cellular processes that underlie the initiation and progression of cancer.
